intro: Teucrium salviastrum, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, sky-blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Teucrium salviastrum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
